byline.contributor: Traci Angel reported from Kansas City, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Julia Preston contributed reporting.
byline.original: By TRACI ANGEL and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Pablo A Serrano-Vitorino, Mexican man in United States illegally, is captured by federal authorities and charged with five murders in Kansas and Missouri; officials say he should have been deported in 2014 following three previous arrests but was set free due to procedural errors.
lead_paragraph: Pablo A. Serrano-Vitorino, a Mexican man accused of killing five people, should have been jailed or deported last year, officials said.

headline.main: Series of Errors Allowed Shooting Suspect, in U.S. Illegally, to Remain
headline.print_headline: Errors Led to Releases of Murder Suspect in U.S. Illegally

snippet: Pablo A. Serrano-Vitorino, a Mexican man accused of killing five people, should have been jailed or deported last year, officials said.
